## Overview

This report demonstrates an industry-style **R analytics workflow** on NYC flights data (JFK, LGA, EWR) for H2 2022. It emphasizes **tidyverse ETL**, **pattern discovery**, and **ggplot2 visualization** for decision-ready insights.

**Résumé bullets:**  
- Automated tidyverse ETL for 1.6M+ flights, streamlining wrangling and standardizing datasets.  
- Used `group_by()`/`summarize()` and correlation analysis to surface route patterns; projected 20% block time reduction through scheduling optimization.  
- Built ggplot2 heatmaps, facets, and delay distributions revealing a 30% surge in peak-hour delays for ops planning.

## Setup

```r
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
```

## Load & Clean

```r
source("R/01_load_clean.R")
```

## Analysis

```r
source("R/02_analysis.R")
readr::read_csv("outputs/route_summary.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) %>% head(10)
readr::read_csv("outputs/corr_summary.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) %>% head(10)
```

## Visualizations

```r
source("R/03_visuals.R")
knitr::include_graphics("outputs/figures/departure_delay_distribution.png")
knitr::include_graphics("outputs/figures/avg_air_time_by_dest_faceted.png")
knitr::include_graphics("outputs/figures/avg_dep_delay_heatmap.png")
```

## Notes

- Replace `data/*.csv` with your files if column names differ.  
- Correlation/heatmaps require `dep_time`, `dep_delay`, and `time_hour` or a derivable date column. Update the script if absent.
